page.title: 17LOCAL RADIO IN THROWLEY
page.content: The local radio stations that serve Throwley are Radio Kent (BBC) and the independent Invicta Radio. They serve the local community with local news and events, advice on weather and road conditions, and provide a forum for individuals and groups with particular interests. Throwley school made use of the "snowline" service in January 1985 when severe weather closed the school. Throwley school also sought the use of Radio Kent in its quest for information for the Domesday Project. The whole school was invited to the studios in Chatham on the 8th July to take part in Barbara Sturgeon's current affairs programme. We watched the local news being broadcast and then talked about our Domesday work live on the air. We asked people with useful information to contact us.
